ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: With no doubt, I would recommend it.
Recommend highly. This is the best class I have ever taken.
I highly recommend taking this course!
I would definitely recommend Physics 608 to another student. The material is interesting, the workload is manageable and the course was taught extremely well.
Physics 608 with Professor Appelquist is the best taught required class for first years.

I would definitely recommend this course to any students who wants an introduction to the advanced topics of quantum mechanics. The course is challenging, but allows one to appreciate the scope of the discipline by connecting topics like path integrals and the Dirac equation to already well known classical results.
PHY608 is a difficult class which require a strong commitment. Homework is heavy.You should take PHY608 only if you really like QM... or if you have to take it.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I understand quantum mechanics better than I did before.
I think we all came away with either a new or deepened understanding of every topic prof. Appelquist touched on. He did a wonderful job.
it has certainly deepen my knowledge of physics!
This course definitely gave me more insight to more advanced concepts in quantum mechanics.
This course gave me a very good grounding in perturbation theory, a topic that is very important in the experimental aspects of quantum science that I am pursuing for my degree.
Understand peturbation and scattering methods much better now. Two-level system in time-dependent perturbation theory very helpful for research in quantum computation.
Focusing on biophysics, this class does not help me for my research.
